results.title: Cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis: a family study of sterol 27-hydroxylase mutations and pharmacotherapy.
results.text_hl: We conclude that @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis_Cerebrotendinous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019294 @@@CTX@@@ in this English pedigree is probably due to compound mutant alleles in @GENE_CYP27A1 @GENE_1593 @@@CYP27@@@, that combined hyperlipidaemia in this family is unrelated to @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis_Cerebrotendinous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019294 @@@CTX@@@, and that this complicated condition responds optimally to the combination of @CHEMICAL_Chenodeoxycholic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002635 @@@CDCA@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Watts GF, Mitchell WD, Bending JJ, Reshef A, Leitersdorf E. Cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis: a family study of sterol 27-hydroxylase mutations and pharmacotherapy. QJM. 1996 Jan;89(1):55-63. PMID: 8730343

results.title: Monitoring of 7alpha-hydroxy-4-cholesten-3-one during therapy of cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis: a case report.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis_Cerebrotendinous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019294 @@@Cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis_Cerebrotendinous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019294 @@@CTX@@@) is a rare, inherited @DISEASE_Myopathy_with_Abnormal_Lipid_Metabolism @DISEASE_MESH:C562935 @@@autosomal-recessive lipid-storage disorder@@@ caused by @DISEASE_Cataract_Nuclear_Progressive @DISEASE_MESH:C564596 @@@27-hydroxylase deficiency@@@.
